Name.label: X-linked central congenital hypothyroidism with late-onset testicular enlargement

TextSection.Contents: X-linked central congenital hypothyroidism with late-onset testicular enlargement is a rare, genetic, endocrine disease characterized by central hypothyroidism, testis enlargement in adolescence resulting in adult macroorchidism, delayed pubertal testosterone rise with a subsequent delayed pubertal growth spurt, small thyroid gland, and variable prolactin and growth hormone deficiency.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: X-linked central congenital hypothyroidism with late-onset macroorchidism

Name.label: Disease-causing germline mutation(s) (loss of function) in
